Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset=utf-8

Nightshift slowly walks up but sits down a safe distance from the beam.  He=
 knew better than to attempt tripping the system.   

" Slag, I knew it.  A=
in't gonna be easy that's for sure.   Normally I'd say we get inta the vent=
 system , but that could be bugged too.  Maan I wish I had a nano droid."

=
He starts to get a tickle in his throat that gets more bothersome by the se=
cond.   In no time it almost appears as if he's choking, as he wretches to =
try and clear his airway.   And then with a final, and forceful cough, he s=
pits out a sphere covered with black fur, and a tiny flashing beacon inside=
.

It surprises him as he looks to Batscout.

" What the pit just came outa=
 me?"

Don't be envious of what you don't have, be grateful for things you =
already posses.  Nothing is worth more than family and friends.

On Nov 17,=
 2011, at 12:25 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> > <O=
LD>
> >
> > Nightshift sniffs the air, sensing a suspicious property to wha=
t could be
> > behind the door. He was not about to make any foolish moves =
but, he wanted
> > to hear what was happening on the other side.
> >
> > " =
Okay, catch twenty one. In order ta find out what's go'n down we gotta be
>=
 > right up ta that door without gett'n spotted. But if we do that, we risk=

> > tripp'n off a security alarm. Batscout, see if ya spot any gaps around=
 the
> > door. You got a better chance at it than I do."
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> Th=
e door itself was at the end of the tunnel, it looked to be made of
> some =
sort of dense metal and was fairly solid as doors go. The way to
> the door=
 was completely clear and BATSCOUT nodded and flapped his way
> up to it.
>=
 
> A beam of red scanning beam shined out from BATSCOUT as he analyzed
> t=
he door intensively. He paused and then sent one again.
> 
> "The door is n=
ot responding to the standard overide codes." BATSCOUT
> said softly in a h=
eavily computerized voice. "Full security measures
> are still in place aro=
und the door. Any attempt to open it will
> trigger an alarm as well send e=
lectricty through the door itself."
> 
> BATSCOUT flapped his way back a li=
ttle to let NIGHTSHIFT nearer the
> door if he so desired.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> =
Preston
> 

--Apple-Mail-3ACD5237-26AF-4B14-B46E-742F43D346A5

 <div id=3D"ygrp-text">
      
      
      <p>> <OLD><br>
><br=
>
> Nightshift sniffs the air, sensing a suspicious property to what cou=
ld be<br>
> behind the door.  He was not about to make any foolish moves=
 but, he wanted<br>
> to hear what was happening on the other side.<br>
=
><br>
> " Okay, catch twenty one.  In order ta find out what's go'n d=
own we gotta be<br>
> right up ta that door without gett'n spotted.  But=
 if we do that, we risk<br>
> tripp'n off a security alarm.  Batscout, s=
ee if ya spot any gaps around the<br>
> door.  You got a better chance a=
t it than I do."<br>
<br>
<NEW><br>
<br>
The door itself was at the e=
nd of the tunnel, it looked to be made of<br>
some sort of dense metal and =
was fairly solid as doors go. The way to<br>
the door was completely clear =
and BATSCOUT nodded and flapped his way<br>
up to it.<br>
<br>
A beam of re=
d scanning beam shined out from BATSCOUT as he analyzed<br>
the door intens=
ively. He paused and then sent one again.<br>
<br>
"The door is not respond=
ing to the standard overide codes." BATSCOUT<br>
said softly in a heavily c=
omputerized voice. "Full security measures<br>
are still in place around th=
e door. Any attempt to open it will<br>
trigger an alarm as well send elect=
ricty through the door itself."<br>
<br>
BATSCOUT flapped his way back a li=
ttle to let NIGHTSHIFT nearer the<br>
door if he so desired.<br>
<br>
(TAG)=
<br>
<br>
Preston<br>
